Description: Part of body of a large pottery bowl (or lid); outside, (if a bowl) rays at base, lotus and bud frieze above; three lines and two bands between. Interior black-glazed, with two bands of white-red-white lines above and below a narrow reserved band. Fine orange clay with quite a few lime inclusions; lustrous black glaze.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 228, no. 139)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 117, pl. XXXVI, no. 329.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.287)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4697 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
